page.title: 01General overview of villages
page.content: This area of SOMERSET consists of rolling hills, wooded valleys and verdant pasture. The land rises to 309 feet south-east of Clatworthy Reervoir. The River Tone flows into Clatworthy Reservoir from a south- easterly direction. There are two small settlements in the area,the villages of Clatworthy and Huish Champflower.Amenities in both this villages are limited. Clatworthy boasts a small village store and a pottery shop whilst Huish Champflower has a post office and public house.Both villages have churches which date from the Middle Ages with attractive stone towers. The area is sparsely populated with most of the local people working on farms or commuting to Taunton, Bridgwater or Minehead. There is evidence to suggest that old farm
